title: Rebel leader
data:
The **rebel leader**, @, is the [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble") [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") as well as [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and the ringleader of the peasant revolt at the heart of the default [Noble quest](/wiki/Noble_quest "Noble quest"). The rebel leader is accompanied by three other unique monsters: the **adventuring wizard**, the **militant cleric**, and the **half-elf ranger**.

Note that Fighter/Ranger/Cleric/Wizard is a common configuration for the stereotypical four-person D\&D party.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Rebel Ringleader](#Rebel_Ringleader)
- [2 Adventuring Wizard](#Adventuring_Wizard)
- [3 Militant Cleric](#Militant_Cleric)
- [4 Half-Elf Ranger](#Half-Elf_Ranger)
- [5 References](#References)

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                            |
| The Rebel Ringleader:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivore "Herbivore").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor").
* wants your [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").
* waits for you to come.
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"), the [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead"), the [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation"), and your [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                                            |

*"A powerful warrior with a silver sword."*

The Rebel Ringleader is the true [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis"), as it is she who carries the [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") (the [Mantle of Heaven](/wiki/Mantle_of_Heaven "Mantle of Heaven") or [Vestment of Hell](/wiki/Vestment_of_Hell "Vestment of Hell")) and the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"), and it is her death that produces the "nemesis death" message. Be warned, however, that the other unique monsters will teleport to and pick up the Bell and the Quest artifact if given the chance.

She is well-armed with a [silver saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber"), [gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail "Gray dragon scale mail"), [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield"), and [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots"). The saber may be especially dangerous to a [vampiric](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)") Noble.

* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").

* wants the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening").
* waits for you to come.

* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                                               |

*"A man of magic. At his word the elements rise up and energy rains down; but as any true mage knows, [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") will kill you faster than flames!"*

The adventuring wizard has a [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [leather armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor"), a [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe"), and [low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots"). His [spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") of choice are Sleep, Magic Missile, and Summon [Sphere](/wiki/Sphere "Sphere").

* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                                                       |

*"A holy man. He can heal his friends and [set the sky on fire](/wiki/Fire_pillar "Fire pillar")."*

The militant cleric has a [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [plate mail](/wiki/Plate_mail "Plate mail"), a [large shield](/wiki/Large_shield "Large shield"), and [iron shoes](/wiki/Iron_shoes "Iron shoes"). He is able to heal himself or allies, and use the clerical attack spell [fire pillar](/wiki/Fire_pillar "Fire pillar").

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                |

| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | No                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | 1450                                                                                                                           |
| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | 400                                                                                                                            |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | medium                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                |
| A half-elf ranger:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivore "Herbivore").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is an [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor").
* wants the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening").
* waits for you to come.
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"), the [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead"), the [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation"), and your [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                |

*"A woman of nature. She fights with arrows of [the moon's metal](/wiki/Silver "Silver")."*

The half-elf ranger has two [elven short swords](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword"), an [elven bow](/wiki/Elven_bow "Elven bow"), a quiver of blessed [silver arrows](/wiki/Silver_arrow "Silver arrow") and mostly elven armor[elven mithril-coat](/wiki/Elven_mithril-coat "Elven mithril-coat"), [elven leather helm](/wiki/Elven_leather_helm "Elven leather helm"), [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak"), and [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots").

Her arrows may be especially dangerous to a [vampiric](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)") Noble.

## References

Reference: [Chris' Noble Patch](https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dnethack/commit/980737c5e4fca9299af8f797d159182f7c2bc242)

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Rebel leader

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The rebel leader, @, is the Noble quest nemesis in dNetHack as well as SlashTHEM, and the ringleader of the peasant revolt at the heart of the default Noble quest. The rebel leader is accompanied by three other unique monsters: the adventuring wizard, the militant cleric, and the half-elf ranger.

Note that Fighter/Ranger/Cleric/Wizard is a common configuration for the stereotypical four-person D&D party.

Contents

  • 1 Rebel Ringleader
  • 2 Adventuring Wizard
  • 3 Militant Cleric
  • 4 Half-Elf Ranger
  • 5 References

Rebel Ringleader

@ Rebel Ringleader
Difficulty 17
Attacks Weapon 1d8 physical, Weapon 1d6 physical, Claw 1d4 quest artifact theft
@ Rebel Ringleader
Difficulty 17
Attacks

Weapon 1d8 physical, Weapon 1d6 physical, Claw 1d4 quest artifact theft

Base level 14
Base experience 344
Speed 16
Base AC 10
Base MR 30
Alignment 10 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium

The Rebel Ringleader:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor.
  • wants your quest artifact.
  • waits for you to come.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor, the Bell of Opening, the Book of the Dead, the Candelabrum of Invocation, and your quest artifact.
  • can be seen through infravision.

"A powerful warrior with a silver sword."

The Rebel Ringleader is the true quest nemesis, as it is she who carries the quest artifact (the Mantle of Heaven or Vestment of Hell) and the Bell of Opening, and it is her death that produces the "nemesis death" message. Be warned, however, that the other unique monsters will teleport to and pick up the Bell and the Quest artifact if given the chance.

She is well-armed with a silver saber, gray dragon scale mail, small shield, and high boots. The saber may be especially dangerous to a vampiric Noble.

Adventuring Wizard

@ adventuring wizard
Difficulty 17
Attacks Weapon 1d1 physical, Cast 0d0 mage spell
@ adventuring wizard
Difficulty 17
Attacks

Weapon 1d1 physical, Cast 0d0 mage spell

Base level 14
Base experience 346
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 30
Alignment 10 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium

The adventuring wizard:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor.
  • wants the Bell of Opening.
  • waits for you to come.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor, the Bell of Opening, the Book of the Dead, the Candelabrum of Invocation, and your quest artifact.
  • can be seen through infravision.

"A man of magic. At his word the elements rise up and energy rains down; but as any true mage knows, sleep will kill you faster than flames!"

The adventuring wizard has a quarterstaff, leather armor, a robe, and low boots. His spells of choice are Sleep, Magic Missile, and Summon Sphere.

Militant Cleric

@ militant cleric
Difficulty 17
Attacks Weapon 1d8 physical, Cast 0d0 clerical spell
@ militant cleric
Difficulty 17
Attacks

Weapon 1d8 physical, Cast 0d0 clerical spell

Base level 14
Base experience 346
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 30
Alignment 10 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium

The militant cleric:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor.
  • wants the Bell of Opening.
  • waits for you to come.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor, the Bell of Opening, the Book of the Dead, the Candelabrum of Invocation, and your quest artifact.
  • can be seen through infravision.

"A holy man. He can heal his friends and set the sky on fire."

The militant cleric has a mace, plate mail, a large shield, and iron shoes. He is able to heal himself or allies, and use the clerical attack spell fire pillar.

Half-Elf Ranger

@ half-elf ranger
Difficulty 17
Attacks Weapon 1d4 physical, Weapon 1d4 physical, Arrow 1d3 silver
@ half-elf ranger
Difficulty 17
Attacks

Weapon 1d4 physical, Weapon 1d4 physical, Arrow 1d3 silver

Base level 14
Base experience 347
Speed 16
Base AC 10
Base MR 2
Alignment -3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium

A half-elf ranger:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is an elf.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor.
  • wants the Bell of Opening.
  • waits for you to come.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor, the Bell of Opening, the Book of the Dead, the Candelabrum of Invocation, and your quest artifact.
  • can be seen through infravision.

"A woman of nature. She fights with arrows of the moon's metal."

The half-elf ranger has two elven short swords, an elven bow, a quiver of blessed silver arrows and mostly elven armor—elven mithril-coat, elven leather helm, elven cloak, and high boots.

Her arrows may be especially dangerous to a vampiric Noble.

References

Reference: Chris' Noble Patch

The rebel leader is accompanied by three other unique monsters: the '''adventuring wizard''', the '''militant cleric''', and the '''half-elf ranger'''. 

Note that Fighter/Ranger/Cleric/Wizard is a common configuration for the stereotypical four-person D&D party.
